snippet: According to Palestinian reports, an interim unity government would be led, at least at first, by Mahmoud Abbas, the current president of the Palestinian Authority.
abstract: Leaders of the rival Palestinian movements Fatah and Hamas might have found a way to break a long political deadlock by forming an interim unity government that would be led, at least at first, by Mahmoud Abbas, the president of the Palestinian Authority based in the West Bank.

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: According to Palestinian reports, an interim unity government would be led, at least at first, by Mahmoud Abbas, the current president of the Palestinian Authority.

headline.seo: Palestinians Consider Abbas to Lead Interim Body
headline.main: Abbas Considered to Lead Interim Palestinian Body
headline.print_headline: Abbas Considered to Lead Interim Palestinian Body
